subject: VAM suddenly stops working
description_text:
Hi,

In less than a month of using it just on weekends, it seems one of the
vibration module is already broken. It can be detected in the simsonn
manager software but when clicking vibration button, the VAM does not
vibrate. Other VAM modules are working fine. I remove the VAM module from
the pedals, and tried to shake them, i notice that there is a very
noticible clanking when shaking the defective VAM. I seem something loose
inside. See attached video.

conversations.body_text: Hi Rolie Agustin,  Please update to the latest SIMSONN Manager 2.1.0 and correctly set the maximum force for the VAM in SIMHUB as well. You may also open the VAM and provide photos so we can analyze the damage. At the same time, we will send you a replacement. Please provide your order number, contact name, phone number, and address.
Hi Rolie Agustin,  Please send the video via Google Drive. The video you provided cannot be viewed, likely due to restricted access.

Gdrive link:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/17w366t8EqWL3FfiaBxRSiNzrrPtrtX0M/view?usp=drivesdk

On Tue, 19 Aug 2025, 12:16 pm support@simsonn.com,

Both simsonn manager and simhub are updated. Other VAM is ok, so i think
the configuration is correct.

I opened the defective VAM. And the RED wire was disconnected. I also
noticed that the plastic inside was melted. I think this VAM overheated and
melted the plastic casing and then since the plastic was melted the
vibration motor was no longer seated properly inside the casing. So the
motor, circled around the casing and snapped the wiring.





On Tue, 19 Aug 2025, 12:15 pm support@simsonn.com,

Hi Rolie Agustin,  We will improve the fixing method and enhance the welding quality. Today, we will send you a replacement VAM.      Please provide your order number, contact person, phone number, and shipping address.
